This is possible by clicking a position or an account from the position listing - after this, only the transactions/trade orders related to the chosen security or account are listed in the Transactions sections. When clicking a position/account, the following transaction/trade orders are listed:

title: Show transaction/trade orders related to a position or an account
body: Transactions that have the clicked security as transaction's security.

title: Show transaction/trade orders related to a position or an account
body: Transactions that have the clicked account as transaction's account.

title: Show transaction/trade orders related to a position or an account
body: Transactions that have the clicked security as transaction's second security (for example, if there are exchanges, those are shown when clicking on either of the positions involved).

title: Show transaction/trade orders related to a position or an account
body: Transactions that have the clicked security's linked security as transaction's security (for example, when clicking on a future cashflow position will also show the contract related to it) (Available from FA 3.7 onward).

title: Hiding transactions from the Overview
body: You can hide certain transactions from the Overview’s transaction listing. You can do this by marking your transaction as Hidden – hidden transactions still affect your positions, but they are not shown on the Overview’s transaction listing. This allows you to filter the Overview to only show transactions you need in your day-to-day work to get an overview of your client’s investments, while you can access other transactions through the Transactions view. This is especially useful for bookkeeping transactions, such as deferrals or value adjustments, which don’t affect how much you own, but only alter the position’s values for bookkeeping purposes.

title: Right-clicking a transaction
body: To Modify or Delete a transaction or a trade order, right-click it. You can select multiple transactions or trade orders by holding the Ctrl key. The changes are then applied to all of the selected items.

title: Portfolio hierarchy
body: The upper section on the left shows the contents or the positions in the selected portfolio(s):

title: Portfolio hierarchy
body: If you have selected a portfolio or customer, the portfolio hierarchy shows the customer and all the portfolios of the customer. If the customer shown is marked as a contact in another customer's portfolio, this another customer and the portfolio are shown below the customer's portfolios.

title: Portfolio hierarchy
body: If you have selected a group, the portfolio hierarchy shows the portfolios within the chosen group, grouping the portfolios under their customers.

title: Portfolio hierarchy
body: Your selection is shown with a blue background. Customers and portfolios are shown in alphabetical order based on the name.

title: Portfolio hierarchy
body: The portfolio hierarchy section is limited to show only certain number of portfolios, by default 500. You can configure in Portfolios Preferences how many portfolios are shown in the tree. The title of the section indicates how many portfolios the tree is showing if your selection exceeds the maximum (available from FA 3.3 onward). This is relevant if you select a group with more than the number of portfolios show, all of them won't be shown within the tree. However, the entire selected group is included when showing the aggregated positions.

title: Portfolio hierarchy
body: Portfolio hierarchy allows you to perform certain actions through right-clicking a level in the tree:

title: Portfolio hierarchy
body: Open group / Open contact / Open portfolio. Opens the chosen group / contact / portfolio in the corresponding window, where you can view and modify the information. The same functionality can be accessed by double-clicking an item in the tree.

title: Portfolio hierarchy
body: Close portfolio. Allows you to close the selected portfolio for bookkeeping purposes. Closing a portfolio is related to balancing the books: the portfolio is closed at the end of each accounting period and is re-opened at the beginning of the accounting period. The portfolio closing is defined by setting the close date, closing method (No change, Depreciation, Depreciation and refund or Market value) and the transaction types for the Remove and Add transactions to be created for closing the portfolio. Selecting a transaction type for only Remove or Add supports closing a portfolio with only one transaction type.

title: Portfolio hierarchy
body: Rebalancing. Opens the Rebalance window for rebalancing the selected portfolio.

title: Portfolio hierarchy
body: New portfolio / New transaction / New trade order / New contract. Allows you to create a new portfolio for your contact or a new transaction, trade order or contract in your portfolio.

title: Portfolio hierarchy
body: Processes. Launches any process against a position through the right-click menu.

title: Memo
body: The second info panel shows the comments and notes written for the selected customer or portfolio. The information is defined in the Memo tab of the Portfolio or Contact window: the Memo shows the text written in the fields Memo, Description, Info 2 and Info 3.

title: Memo
body: You can modify the memo by clicking it once, making the desired modifications and confirming the changes when navigating away. Portfolio or customer memos can be also be modified in the Memo tab on the Portfolio or Contact window - double-clicking the memo panel opens the correct window for modifications. It is also possible to import text to the Memo from an external text file from Import - Import memos.

title: Memo
body: In Memo, the different tab sheets contain information for both the customer (the first, left-hand side tab) and the selected portfolio (the following tab). The mark * next to the customer or portfolio ID in the tab sheet heading indicates that the memo has some content. If the customer and the portfolio have the same ID, it is good to remember that the customer memo is always under the farthest left tab sheet.

title: Portfolio / Contact / Group basic info
body: You can use the third info panel to view the basic information of the chosen portfolio, contact or dynamic group. The information shown corresponds to the information defined on the Basic info tab sheet on the Portfolio or Contact window or the dynamic group information defined on the Groups view.

title: Portfolio / Contact / Group basic info
body: The portfolio or contact information can be accessed from the edit button on the top-right corner of the basic info panel, or by searching the portfolio or customer from the Portfolios or Contacts view.

title: Documents
body: You can use the fourth info panel to view the documents of the chosen contact or portfolio. The documents can be managed through the Documents section of the info panel: you can view the documents, edit them, or add new documents to your chosen contact or portfolio from the Overview.

title: Fund wizard
body: The Fund wizard lets you set up a fund or edit settings for an existing fund in FA Fund Management app. When you set up a fund in the FA Fund management app, FA creates a fund portfolio with the specified properties in FA Back to store the fund information and manage fund investments.

title: Fund wizard
body: To set up a new fund, click the Add fund button at the top-right of the NAV status view. To view and edit the settings of an existing fund, click the Edit fund button in the Fund details pane.

title: Fund wizard
body: The Fund wizard fields are described below.

title: Basic info tab
body: The Basic info tab contains the basic information about the fund.

title: Basic info tab
body: Fund company*

title: Basic info tab
body: The company the fund is administered by. See Fund company wizard.

title: Basic info tab
body: Language*

title: Basic info tab
body: The language to be used in portfolio reports. You can also see the language of the fund in the contact of the company in FA Back.

title: Basic info tab
body: Juridical*

title: Basic info tab
body: Juridical form of the fund company. You can also see the juridical form in the contact of the company in FA Back.

title: Basic info tab
body: Name*

title: Basic info tab
body: Fund name.

title: Basic info tab
body: Fund business ID

title: Basic info tab
body: The ID provided by the authorities for your fund. Fund business ID is used for tax reporting purposes. The ID is saved in FA Back. You can find it in the Portfolio window, IDs tab.

title: Basic info tab
body: ID*

title: Basic info tab
body: A unique fund ID used to identify the fund and search for funds. You should only use numbers and letters (a-z).

title: Basic info tab
body: Currency*

title: Basic info tab
body: Fund currency. Once you create a fund, the currency can't be changed.

title: Basic info tab
body: Valuation method*

title: Basic info tab
body: Valuation method for the fund portfolio:

title: Basic info tab
body: Average price

title: Basic info tab
body: Average price with adjustments – Uses transaction types that control the market value of the positions with the transaction's trade amount, such as Private Equity transaction types.

title: Basic info tab
body: Average price with separate items – Valuates portfolio with average price, but keeps track of original purchase dates.

title: Basic info tab
body: FIFO

title: Basic info tab
body: FIFO (combined) – Valuates the portfolio based directly on transactions in the subportfolios.

title: Basic info tab
body: FIFO with adjustments – Uses transaction types that control the market value of the positions with the transaction's trade amount, such as Private Equity transaction types.

title: Basic info tab
body: Type*

title: Basic info tab
body: Portfolio type. Choose the type that corresponds to the fund portfolio.

title: Cash accounts
body: Cash accounts for the fund.

title: Cash accounts
body: Name*

title: Cash accounts
body: Account name.

title: Cash accounts
body: Currency*

title: Cash accounts
body: Account currency.

title: Cash accounts
body: Account number*

title: Cash accounts
body: The account number, for example, the bank account number.

title: Cash accounts
body: Set as default account

title: Cash accounts
body: Set the account as the default account of the portfolio. All transactions are by default created against this account.

title: Cash accounts
body: Shared to all parent portfolio's subportfolios

title: Cash accounts
body: Make the account available in the parent portfolio and in the other portfolios under the parent portfolio. Choose this option, for example, if you are going to use FX-hedged share classes in your fund. For details, see Manage funds with FX-hedged share classes.

title: Share class wizard
body: The Share class wizard lets you create, edit or delete a fund share class. When you create a share class in the Fund management app, FA creates a share class security with the specified properties in FA Back.

title: Share class wizard
body: To add a share class, click the button in the Fund details pane.

title: Share class wizard
body: To edit a share class, click the button in the Share class details pane.

title: Share class wizard
body: To delete a share class click Delete in the Share class wizard. You can delete a share class only if it doesn't have any transactions and isn't used in benchmarks.

title: Basic info tab
body: Share class details and NAV calculation settings.

title: Basic info tab
body: Code*

title: Basic info tab
body: A unique code defined for the share class. The code is used to identify the share class security and search for securities in the system. We recommend using numbers and letters (a-z) and avoiding special characters in the security code.

title: Basic info tab
body: ISIN

title: Basic info tab
body: The ISIN code of the share class security.

title: Basic info tab
body: Name*

title: Basic info tab
body: Name of the share class security.

title: Basic info tab
body: Type*

title: Basic info tab
body: Share class security type. Choose the type that is configured for funds in Preferences. If you have standard solution configuration, use Collective investment vehicles type.

title: Basic info tab
body: Holiday calendar*

title: Basic info tab
body: A holiday calendar that determines business days and holidays in the market to set a settlement date for subscriptions and redemptions. Holiday calendar options are configured in Preferences. You can also set the default holiday calendar used for new securities in Preferences.

title: Basic info tab
body: Share class priority

title: Basic info tab
body: The order in which share class NAVs are calculated if there are multiple share classes. The NAV for the share class with the highest priority is calculated first.

title: Basic info tab
body: Decimal count for transaction units

title: Basic info tab
body: Number of decimals used in the units field of the client transactions. If the field is empty, the number of decimals set for the security type is used.

title: Pricing tab
body: Unit price settings:

title: Pricing tab
body: Currency

title: Pricing tab
body: Share class currency – the currency share class units are quoted in.

title: Pricing tab
body: Initial price

title: Pricing tab
body: (Set for a new share class). Initial price of the share class unit. Initial unit price is used for the first NAV calculation. The price you enter is copied to the Market data info tab in the Security window in FA Back.

title: Pricing tab
body: Date of initial price

title: Pricing tab
body: (Set when you create a share class). The date for which the initial unit price is valid.

title: Pricing tab
body: Format

title: Pricing tab
body: Unit price multipliers to use in calculations. For more information about multipliers, see the description of the ??? tab in the Security window. Choose one of the options:

title: Pricing tab
body: Show price as is – Show the share class unit price without any multipliers.

title: Pricing tab
body: In percentage – Use "100" in both Multiplier fields for the security.

title: Pricing tab
body: Add manually – Enter the multipliers in the fields below.

title: Pricing tab
body: Decimals for share class NAV

title: Pricing tab
body: The number of decimals used in the share class NAV. If the field is empty, NAV is stored with 10 decimals.

title: Fee structure tab
body: The Fee structure tab defines costs and fees applied on the share class level. Share class-level fees are calculated after the fund level fees, in the order you put them in the Share class wizard. Click Add fee and enter the information about the share class fees:

title: Fund fees
body: Fund fees

title: Fund fees
body: Fee formula

title: Fund fees
body: Fee formula used to calculate the fee and generate fee transaction.

title: Fund fees
body: Fee transaction type

title: Fund fees
body: Transaction type linked to the chosen fee formula.

title: Fund fees
body: Amount or %

title: Fund fees
body: Fee percentage or amount in the fund currency, depending on the fee formula.

title: Fund fees
body: Decimals

title: Fund fees
body: The number of decimals used for calculating fees (0 to 10). The “Default” value is 2 decimals.

title: Fund fees
body: Ex-post cost category

title: Fund fees
body: Ex-post cost category for the fee. The categorization is used in cost analysis and reporting (see View ex-post costs and charges in FA User guide), as well as for creating kickbacks (see Rebate contracts (kickbacks) in FA User guide).

title: Fund fees
body: Additional options

title: Fund fees
body: Additional fee setups.

title: Fund fees
body: Formula sets its own account

title: Fund fees
body: Set an account for the fee formula. For example, this can be useful with accrued account interest transactions over multiple accounts.

title: Fund fees
body: Include in income distribution

title: Fund fees
body: Include the fee in the income distribution calculation.

title: Fund fees
body: Use crystallization schedule for capitalization

title: Fund fees
body: Capitalize fees automatically on the crystallization date when you accept NAV. The crystallization dates are defined in the Fund wizard, Schedules tab. Fees are capitalized to the account that has “Fee capitalization” tag. If no account is marked with this tag, fees are capitalized to the default cash account.

title: Transaction fees
body: The Transaction fees section contains parameters for subscription and redemption fees and charging them automatically when you calculate NAV. Enter the subscription and redemption fee parameters:

title: Transaction fees
body: Calculate fee for net trade amount-based subscriptions

title: Transaction fees
body: The amount from which the subscription fee is calculated in net trade amount-based trade orders: order trade amount or the sum invested in the fund.

title: Transaction fees
body: Define default transaction fees

title: Transaction fees
body: Settings for subscription and redemption fees calculated automatically and included in the transaction:

title: Transaction fees
body: Cost percentage

title: Transaction fees
body: Fee percentage to calculate the fee amount.

title: Transaction fees
body: To set the fee as a fixed amount per transaction, enter "0" as a cost percentage and then specify the fee amount in the Minimum field.

title: Transaction fees
body: Minimum

title: Transaction fees
body: The minimum fee amount to charge.

title: Transaction fees
body: Currency

title: Transaction fees
body: Fee currency automatically set to the share class currency.

title: Performance fee equalization
body: The Performance fee equalization section contains parameters to calculate and equalize performance fee. In addition to choosing the fee parameters here, you need to define the crystallization schedule in the Fund wizard, Schedules tab, and the fee formula in the Fund wizard, Fee structure tab.

title: Performance fee equalization
body: Fee percentage

title: Performance fee equalization
body: Fee percentage to calculate the fee amount.

title: Performance fee equalization
body: Hurdle rate

title: Performance fee equalization
body: The minimum NAV increase above HWM starting from which the performance fee is paid.

title: Performance fee equalization
body: Day count

title: Performance fee equalization
body: Day count convention to use in performance fee calculation with hurdle rate. If the calculation period is less than a year, the hurdle rate is adjusted proportionally using the day count convention you chose.

title: Performance fee equalization
body: High-water mark

title: Performance fee equalization
body: The initial high water mark (HWM) to use for the performance fee calculation. Usually, HWM is set to the highest NAV value in the share class. On the crystallization date, FA Fund Management compares the share class NAV to the HWM. If NAV is higher than HWM, the HWM value is updated to the current NAV value.

title: Performance fee equalization
body: High-water mark date

title: Performance fee equalization
body: The date on which high-water mark is set.

title: Cash transactions tab
body: Account settings to handle deposits and withdrawals.

title: Cash transactions tab
body: Account number

title: Cash transactions tab
body: A fund portfolio account to record deposits and withdrawals to. If the field is empty, the account in the fund settings or the default account is used.

title: Tax reporting tab
body: Settings for the Finnish tax reporting: fund company business ID and fund business ID.

title: FX hedging tab
body: FX hedging settings to apply if your share class currency is different from the fund currency and you want to use FX hedging to neutralize the effect of the exchange rate. Click Enable FX hedging and fill in the fields. For full instruction on how to set up and manage FX-hedged share classes, see Manage funds with FX-hedged share classes in FA User guide.

title: FX hedging tab
body: Formula

title: FX hedging tab
body: The formula for the FX hedge accrual. You can choose the "FX hedge formula" that comes pre-configured in Standard solution.

title: FX hedging tab
body: FX hedge transaction type

title: FX hedging tab
body: Transaction type linked to the FX hedging formula.

title: FX hedging tab
body: Hedge parent portfolio

title: FX hedging tab
body: ID and portfolio type of the hedge parent portfolio that links fund and hedge portfolios in FA Back. The hedge parent portfolio is empty. It is used only for linking purposes.

title: FX hedging tab
body: Hedge portfolio

title: FX hedging tab
body: ID and portfolio type of the hedge portfolio that contains FX contracts in FA Back.

title: FA audit logs
body: FA audit logs let you track user activities related to sensitive customer data and changes in preferences that can modify the business logic.

title: Customer information logs
body: FA records logging in and out, opening windows, making selections on Overview, searches, report generations, PDF and XLS exports. Each audit trail entry includes details about the user, time, and screen, and information the user accessed or exported.

title: Logged from FA Back
body: Logged from FA Back

body: Log in / log out

body: View information

body: Search

body: Manage documents

title: Export data
body: Export data

title: Generate reports
body: Generate reports

title: Logged from FA Fund Management
body: Logged from FA Fund Management

title: Changes in system settings
body: FA tracks changes in system settings that can affect FA functionality and system logic.

title: Logged from FA Back
body: Logged from FA Back

title: Manage preferences
body: Manage preferences

title: Forms view
body: The Forms view provides you access to the form.io builder to design forms that you can embed in HTML pages. Forms can be accessed through the GraphQL API.

title: Forms view
body: Forms let you collect information that can be further handled by external apps. For example, an app can display a form for new clients to fill in and save the data in FA or print it out as a PDF. To implement this, the form should be included in a process via the User task element.

title: List of forms
body: The Forms view shows the List of forms with the following columns:

title: List of forms
body: Name

title: List of forms
body: The form name is for you to distinguish between the forms, it isn’t shown anywhere else.

title: List of forms
body: Form ID

title: List of forms
body: The form ID is used to include a form in a process (specify it as a form key value of the User task element when designing a process).

title: List of forms
body: Actions

title: List of forms
body: The buttons to manage forms:

title: List of forms
body: Edit translations.

title: List of forms
body: Export form in a file that is save to your computer. Use this feature to copy created forms to another environment.

title: List of forms
body: View, Edit or Delete form.

title: Buttons
body: Add form

title: Buttons
body: The Add form button at the top-right opens the form editor to create a form. The panel on the left contains the list of form components to choose from. To learn more about using the form components, see the Form.io user's guide. To save the form, enter the Form name at the bottom and click Save form.

title: Buttons
body: Import form

title: Buttons
body: The Import form button lets you upload the .faform file with the form. Use this feature to copy forms from other environments.

title: Related links
body: Form.io documentation on how to design a form

title: File formats for importing contacts and portfolios
body: Contact and portfolios are imported in FA in semicolon-separated CSV files, with the file columns described below. You can import multiple entries (contacts or portfolios) at the same time with one file: each row of the CSV file is read as a separate object. However, you cannot import contacts and portfolios to the system with the same file.

title: File formats for importing contacts and portfolios
body: You can define the following properties of the CSV file in Preferences → Importing → File format (see Preference - Importing for details):

title: File formats for importing contacts and portfolios
body: File delimiter. By default, FA is configured to accept semicolon-separated values. You can change it to another character.

title: File formats for importing contacts and portfolios
body: Encoding: UTF-8 or Windows-1252. To import Scandinavian letters, the files should be Windows-1252 encoded in order to guarantee the appropriate handling of Scandinavian letters.

title: File formats for importing contacts and portfolios
body: Download the CSV file templates:

title: File formats for importing contacts and portfolios
body: FAFormat_portfolios.csv

title: File formats for importing contacts and portfolios
body: FAFormat_contacts.csv

title: File formats for importing contacts and portfolios
body: The file columns are described below.

title: Updating contacts and portfolios
body: You can update existing contacts and portfolios by importing a new file with corrected data.

title: Updating contacts and portfolios
body: The system identifies the contact to update by the Contact ID, and the portfolio to update by the Portfolio ID, so these fields must be filled in.

title: Updating contacts and portfolios
body: Note that you must specify if you want to keep the old values in each field:

title: Updating contacts and portfolios
body: To replace the field value, specify the new value in the import file.

title: Updating contacts and portfolios
body: To keep the existing field value saved in the system, add three stars *** in the field. Note: if you import an empty field without ***, the field value previously saved in the system is removed. For multi-value fields, you can import new values while keeping the old ones using three stars (***), for example, ***<new value1>,<new value2>.

title: Updating contacts and portfolios
body: Some fields have specific syntax for updates, see the field descriptions in the tables.

title: Removing contact and portfolio values with three minuses (---)
body: You can remove individual values from multi-value fields by marking them with three minuses (---) in the CSV file. Currently, this syntax can be used for removing tag and profile values (tags and profileAttributes fields). To remove a value, specify the Contact ID or Portfolio ID in the first column and add the values you want to remove prefixed with three minuses (---). If you edit the CSV file in MS Excel, you need to put an apostrophe in the beginning of the column. For example: '---contact.profiling.totalAssets.

title: Removing contact and portfolio values with three minuses (---)
body: To remove multiple values, divide them with a comma for tags, and with a hash (#) for profile attributes. For example: ---<tag name 1>,---<tag name 2> or ---contact.profiling.totalAssets#---contact.profiling.activity.

title: Removing contact and portfolio values with three minuses (---)
body: You can remove certain values and add other ones, for example: --<tag name 1>,<tag name 2> or ---contact.profiling.totalAssets#contact.profiling.activity.

title: File formats for importing contacts and portfolios
body: Contact and portfolios are imported in FA in semicolon-separated CSV files, with the file columns described below. You can import multiple entries (contacts or portfolios) at the same time with one file: each row of the CSV file is read as a separate object. However, you cannot import contacts and portfolios to the system with the same file.

title: File formats for importing contacts and portfolios
body: You can define the following properties of the CSV file in Preferences → Importing → File format (see Preference - Importing for details):

title: File formats for importing contacts and portfolios
body: File delimiter. By default, FA is configured to accept semicolon-separated values. You can change it to another character.

title: File formats for importing contacts and portfolios
body: Encoding: UTF-8 or Windows-1252. To import Scandinavian letters, the files should be Windows-1252 encoded in order to guarantee the appropriate handling of Scandinavian letters.

title: File formats for importing contacts and portfolios
body: Download the CSV file templates:

title: File formats for importing contacts and portfolios
body: FAFormat_portfolios.csv

title: File formats for importing contacts and portfolios
body: FAFormat_contacts.csv

title: File formats for importing contacts and portfolios
body: The file columns are described below.

title: Updating contacts and portfolios
body: You can update existing contacts and portfolios by importing a new file with corrected data.

title: Updating contacts and portfolios
body: The system identifies the contact to update by the Contact ID, and the portfolio to update by the Portfolio ID, so these fields must be filled in.

title: Updating contacts and portfolios
body: Note that you must specify if you want to keep the old values in each field:

title: Updating contacts and portfolios
body: To replace the field value, specify the new value in the import file.

title: Updating contacts and portfolios
body: To keep the existing field value saved in the system, add three stars *** in the field. Note: if you import an empty field without ***, the field value previously saved in the system is removed. For multi-value fields, you can import new values while keeping the old ones using three stars (***), for example, ***<new value1>,<new value2>.

title: Updating contacts and portfolios
body: Some fields have specific syntax for updates, see the field descriptions in the tables.

title: Removing contact and portfolio values with three minuses (---)
body: You can remove individual values from multi-value fields by marking them with three minuses (---) in the CSV file. Currently, this syntax can be used for removing tag and profile values (tags and profileAttributes fields). To remove a value, specify the Contact ID or Portfolio ID in the first column and add the values you want to remove prefixed with three minuses (---). If you edit the CSV file in MS Excel, you need to put an apostrophe in the beginning of the column. For example: '---contact.profiling.totalAssets.

title: Removing contact and portfolio values with three minuses (---)
body: To remove multiple values, divide them with a comma for tags, and with a hash (#) for profile attributes. For example: ---<tag name 1>,---<tag name 2> or ---contact.profiling.totalAssets#---contact.profiling.activity.

title: Removing contact and portfolio values with three minuses (---)
body: You can remove certain values and add other ones, for example: --<tag name 1>,<tag name 2> or ---contact.profiling.totalAssets#contact.profiling.activity.

title: Stub convention
body: Convention Description

title: Stub convention
body: None Explicitly states that there are no stubs. This option is used to indicate that the schedule evenly divides by the frequency, leaving no stubs. For example, 6 months can be exactly divided by a 3 month frequency.

title: Stub convention
body: Short initial Any remaining period, shorter than the frequency, will be allocated at the start. For example, 8 months with a 3 month frequency would result in a 2 month initial short stub followed by two periods of 3 months.

title: Stub convention
body: Long initial Any remaining period, shorter than the frequency, will be allocated at the start and combined with the next period, making a total period longer than the standard frequency. For example, 8 months with a 3 month periodic frequency would result in a 5 month initial long stub followed by one period of 3 months.

title: Stub convention
body: Smart initial Any remaining period, shorter than the frequency, will be allocated at the start. If this results in a stub of less than 7 days, the stub will be combined with the next period. If this results in a stub of 7 days or more, the stub will be retained. This is the equivalent of Long initial up to 7 days and Short initial beyond that. This convention appears to match that used by Bloomberg.

title: Stub convention
body: Short final Any remaining period, shorter than the frequency, will be allocated at the end. For example, 8 months with a 3 month frequency would result in two periods of 3 months followed by a 2 month final short stub.

title: Stub convention
body: Long final Any remaining period, shorter than the frequency, will be allocated at the end and combined with the previous period, making a total period longer than the standard frequency. For example, 8 months with a 3 month frequency would result in one period of 3 months followed by a 5 month final long stub.

title: Stub convention
body: Smart final Any remaining period, shorter than the frequency, will be allocated at the end. If this results in a stub of less than 7 days, the stub will be combined with the next period. If this results in a stub of 7 days or more, the stub will be retained. This is the equivalent of Long final up to 7 days and Short final beyond that. This convention appears to match that used by Bloomberg.

title: Stub convention
body: Both Both ends of the schedule have a stub. Days before the first period start date form the initial stub. Days after the last period end date form the final stub.

title: Business day convention
body: Convention Description

title: Business day convention
body: Following (default) Move to the next valid business day.

title: Business day convention
body: Modified following (without crossing month end) Move to the next valid business day, unless that is in the next month in which case move to the previous valid business day.

title: Business day convention
body: Modified following (without crossing mid-month or month end) Move to the next valid business day, unless that is after the 15th of the month OR in the next month in which case move to the previous valid business day.

title: Business day convention
body: Preceding Move to the previous valid business day.

title: Business day convention
body: Modified preceding (without crossing month start) Move to the previous valid business day, unless that is in the previous month in which case move to the next valid business day.

title: Business day convention
body: Nearest For Sunday and Monday, move to the next valid business day, for all other days, move to the previous valid business day.

title: Business day convention
body: No adjustment Make no adjustment.

To use the first available price in the Manual, Close 1, 2, 3, 4 or 5 columns in the Security window, Market data info tab (checking the column values in the order specified above), specify Default. To determine a different priority of price source fields, enter a comma-separated list of columns in the order of priority. The values are: Manual, Close 1, Close 2, Close 3, Close 4, Close 5. title: FA Format for importing contacts
body: 23 c.representatives No Representatives Comma-separated list of contact IDs representing the contact, for example, 1223,1224,1225. To import contact representative tag values, add them after ###: Standalone tags are added as <representative's contact ID>###<tag name>. For example: 04012000##parent.Single-select group tags are added as <representative's contact ID>###<group name>-<tag name>. For example: 04012000##relative-parent.Multi-select group tags are added as a comma-separated list of values: <representative's contact ID>###<group name>:<tag name 1>,<group name>:<tag name 2>. For example: 04012000###Employee:Finance,Employee:Accounting. You can use *** syntax to add new representatives and keep the existing ones. For example: ***,1223,1224. For details, see Updating contacts and portfolios. To add representatives to the contact that doesn't have any representatives, define "???," in the beginning of the column's content (e.g. ???,1223,1224). If the contact already had representatives, the existing representatives will be kept and the new ones won't be added.

title: FA Format for importing contacts

For example: Fund,ContractOK.Single-select group tags should be added as <group name>-<tag name>. For example: office-Helsinki. If a contact already has a tag with the same group name, the tag is replaced.Multi-select group tags should be added as a comma-separated list of values <group name>:<tag name 1>,<group name>:<tag name 2>. For example: Interests:Golf,Interests:Culture. If a contact already has tags with the same group name, the new tag is added to the existing ones. You can use three minuses (---) syntax to remove a tag: Standalone tags: ---<tag name>. For example: ---Fund,---ContractOK.Single-select group tags: ---<group name>-<tag name>. For example: —office-Helsinki.Multi-select group tags: ---<group name>:<tag name 1>,---<group name>:<tag name 2>. For example: ---Interests:Golf,---Interests:Culture. For details, see Removing contact and portfolio values with three minuses (---).

You can use three minuses (---) syntax to remove a profile attribute value. For example: ---<key>. For details, see Removing contact and portfolio values with three minuses (---).

If ext_id and ext_name combination exist but for a different contact, will show error message.

E.g. AAA=2009-01-01=1.9,2010-01-01=1.10:TAX=2007-01-01=1,2010-01-01=2 When importing categorized key figures (e.g. 1=Low, 2=Medium, 3=High), prior to 3.7.7 you should use the "number" (e.g. 1, 2 or 3), and after 3.7.7 you should use the "text" (e.g. Low, Medium, High). Use the following syntax to import account information: <Account no.>,<Currency with currency code>,<Name>,<Visibility as 0=not visible 1=visible>,<Shared as 0=not shared 1=shared>,<Priority as integer>;<BIC code>,<Mandate>,<Secondary account number>,<Category>,<Cash account as 0=not cash, 1=cash>,<Hide if zero as 0=don’t hide, 1=hide>,<Tags separated with #>,<Issuer with contact ID>,<Calendar with the calendar code>,<Fixing as a number>,<Base instrument with the security code>,<Spread as a number>,<Exclude balance as 0=don't exclude, 1=exclude>,<Shared with all as 0=not shared, 1=shared>, <Shared to all parent portfolio's subportfolios as 0=not shared, 1=shared>, <Decimals for transactions as a number>. For example, a list of two accounts: FI12 3456 78,EUR,Euro account,1,0,1,NDEAFIHHXXX,12345678,12345-678,Bank account,1,0,Client account#Status OK:234-321,USD,Dollar account,0,1,2,,,,,1,0,Client account#Status OK,,US30360,0.2,LIBOR,1.5,0,0,0,4 The account currency (second in the syntax) is validated to be a valid currency in the system. Supported calendar codes: 1/1 30/360ISDA 30/360 PSA 30E+/360 30E/360 30E/360 ISDA 30U/360 30U/360 EOM Act/360 Act/364 Act/365 Actual Act/365.25 Act/365F Act/365L Act/366 Act/366.375 Act/Act AFB Act/Act ICMA Act/Act ISDA Act/Act Year NL/365 You can use *** syntax to add new accounts to the contact and keep the existing ones. For example: ***:<Account>:<Account>). For details, see Updating contacts and portfolios. To update the account number of an existing account, use the syntax "[old account no]new account no" in the first field of the account syntax. For example, if you want to update account number from 1000 to 1010, define the account number in the syntax as [1000]1010. If you try to update the account number of an account that does not exists in the portfolio, importing creates a new account.

For example: Investments:Stocks,Investments:Bonds. If a portfolio already has tags with the same group name, the new tag is added to the existing ones. You can use three minuses (---) syntax to remove a tag: Standalone tags: ---<tag name>. For example: ---Fund,---ContractOK.Single-select group tags: ---<group name>-<tag name>. For example: —office-Helsinki.Multi-select group tags: ---<group name>:<tag name 1>,---<group name>:<tag name 2>. For example: ---Investments:Stocks,---Investments:Bonds. To use the prices from Security's Market data info tab, leave the field empty. To use the first available price from the price fields in the Security's Market data info tab (checking the column values in the order specified above), specify Default. To define a different priority of price source fields, enter a comma-separated list of columns in the order of priority. The values are: Manual, Close 1, Close 2, Close 3, Close 4, Close 5. You can use *** syntax to add new values in the list of price source fields and keep the existing ones. For details, see Updating contacts and portfolios. You can use three minuses (for example, ---Close 1) to remove a value.

(Available from FA 3.8 onward) You can use *** syntax to add new entries to the investment plan and keep the existing ones. For example: ***:2019-01-01,NOKIA=25#20#30,AMAZON=15#10#20. For details, see Updating contacts and portfolios.

title: FA Format for importing portfolios

Use the following syntax to import / update profile information: <key>=<value>:<type>#<key>=<value>:<type> etc. For example: portfolio.mifir.invstmtPtyInd=true:boolean Profile import allows you to add or modify profile values with a specific key - existing profile values are not replaced / removed unless you specifically include their key within the import syntax. To remove an attribute value, use the syntax described in Updating contacts and portfolios. For example: :---<key>. You can use three minuses (---) syntax to remove an attribute value. For example: ---<key>. For details, see Removing contact and portfolio values with three minuses (---).

title: FA Format for importing portfolios
body: 41 p.strategy No Strategy Portfolio specific strategy, use the following syntax <yyyy-MM-dd>,<assetTypeCode1#assetGroupCode1>=<share1#minShare1#maxShare1#FIXED>,<assetTypeCode2#assetGroupCode2>=<share2#minShare2#maxShare2>:<yyyy-MM-dd>,<assetTypeCode3#asset & GroupCode3>=<share3#minShare3#maxShare3> etc. For interpolation, specify "INTERPOLATION", calendar code, and two dates before the asset types. For example: INTERPOLATION=SatSun:<yyyy-MM-dd>,<assetTypeCode1#assetGroupCode1>=<share1#minShare1#maxShare1>,<assetTypeCode2#assetGroupCode2>=<share2#minShare2#maxShare2>, etc. For an asset type that is excluded from strategy analysis, specify "EXCLUDED" followed by three dots: <yyyy-MM-dd>,<assetTypeCode1#assetGroupCode1>=EXCLUDED... You can use *** syntax to add new entries to the strategy and keep the existing ones, for example: ***:2019-01-01,ASSET#MOD=100#0#100. For details, see Updating contacts and portfolios.

For example, AAA=2009-01-01=1.9,2010-01-01=1.10:TAX=2007-01-01=1,2010-01-01=2 You can use *** syntax to add new observations to the list and keep the existing ones. For details, see Updating contacts and portfolios. (Available from FA 3.4 onward)

title: Available columns for positions listings
body: Name (ENG) Name (FI) Name (SWE) Description

title: Available columns for positions listings
body: Amount Amount (p) Amount (p, o) Amount (p, t) Kpl Kpl (p) Kpl (p, o) Kpl (p, t) Antal Antal (p) Antal (p, o) Antal (p, t) Shows the amount of the security in the portfolio based on the transaction date (amount), when all Executable trade orders would have been executed (p, o), when all accepted non-settled (i.e. settlement date later than today or no settlement date at all) transactions would have been settled (p, t) or when all Executable trade orders and accepted non-settled transactions would have been executed and settled (p). For accounts and cash balance, the amount shows the account balance based on transaction date, amount (p, o) the cash balance after Executable trade orders that deduct cash have been executed, amount (p, t) the currently settled cash balance (excluding non-settled transactions, i.e. transactions that have a settlement date in the future), and amount (p) the combination of the two above.

title: Available columns for positions listings
body: Accr. int. Accr. int (c) Kert. korot Kert. korot (v) Upplupen ränta Upplupen räntä (v) Shows the accrued interest for your position in portfolio currency or in security currency (c), when fixing information is defined in security's Extra information. For a new position, the accrued interest is the accrued interest bought within the buy transaction until the settlement date of the buy, after which the accrued interest is calculated with the defined coupon information. Also shows the accrued interest for accounts. For accounts, the accrued interest is calculated day-by-day and is shown as a total amount.

title: Available columns for positions listings
body: Accrual Accrual (c) Kertymä Kertymä (v) Upplupen Upplupen (v) Error parsing MathML: error on line 1 at column 173: Namespace prefix xinfo for text on mi is not defined

title: Available columns for positions listings
body: Change Change (o) Change % Change % (o) Muutos Muutos (a) Muutos-% Muutos-% (a) Förändring Förändring (o) Förändring % Förändring % (o) Shows the difference between the Purchase value and Market value columns: how much the purchase value has changed. Also available as the change between the purchase price and market price columns with the original purchase price (o), in percentage (%) or in percentage with the original purchase price (% (o)).

title: Available columns for positions listings
body: Total commitment Total commitment (c) Remaining commitment Remaining commitment (c) Jäljellä oleva sitoumus Jäljellä oleva sitoumus (v) Kokonaissitoumus Kokonaissitoumus (v) Återstående åtagande Återstående åtagande (v) Total åtagande Total åtagande (v) Shows the total commitment of the position, based on transaction types that increase commitment in portfolio currency or in security currency (c), or the remaining commitment of the position, based on transaction types that either increase or reduce commitment in portfolio currency or in security currency (c). Commitments are relevant for example for private equity investments.

title: Available columns for positions listings
body: Currency (Price) Currency Valuutta (hinta) Valuutta Valuta (pris) Valuta Shows the currency defined for the security or currency exposure. The latter column shows the currency the instrument is exposed to: if the security has an underlay, and the underlay is a currency, the code of the underlying security is shown, otherwise the currency of the underlying security is shown. If the security doesn't have an underlay, and if the security is a currency, the code of the security is shown, otherwise the currency of the security is shown.

title: Available columns for positions listings
body: Days Pv Dagar Shows the position's age in the portfolio, calculated from the the date of the oldest open purchase lot.

title: Available columns for positions listings
body: Exposure Exposure Exposure Error parsing MathML: error on line 1 at column 173: Namespace prefix xinfo for text on mi is not defined

title: Available columns for positions listings
body: Holding % Omistus % Innehav % Shows the share of position’s amount out of the total outstanding amount defined in the security, indicating how large of a share does the portfolio hold of the security.

title: Available columns for positions listings
body: MPrice MPrice (c) Mh/kpl Mh/kpl (v) MPris MPris (v) Shows the current market unit price of the security in the portfolio currency or market price in currency (c). The date in parentheses tells the date of the market unit price: if there is no date after the market unit price, the price observation is dated for the viewing date (chosen above the portfolio contents). If no market price is defined for a security, this columns shows a line.

title: Available columns for positions listings
body: MPrice daily change Mh Pv. muutos MPris daglig förändring Shows the percentage change between the selected date's market price compared to the previous market price found.

title: Available columns for positions listings
body: Market date M. pvm Marknadsdatum Shows the date of the market price utilized as the market unit price and in calculating the market value, if the utilized market price is not the selected day's price.

title: Available columns for positions listings
body: Market val. Markkinahinta Marknadspris Shows the total market price of the security or the account balance in the portfolio currency, based on the latest market price or the exchange rate of the account currency. If no market price is defined for a security, the market price is calculated with the unit purchase price. Market value on the Overview excludes accrual on your fund positions (from FA 3.8 onward) and accrued interests on your bond positions.

title: Available columns for positions listings
body: Market value (d) Markkinahinta (d) Marknadspris (d) Shows the "dirty" market value, or a proper market value for your bonds and futures: this column shows a sum of market value + accrued interest for your bond positions, the P/L for your future positions, sum of market value + accrual for your fund positions (from FA 3.8 onward), and market value for all other types of instruments. (Available from FA 3.7 onward)

title: Available columns for positions listings
body: Market FX rate Markkina-valuuttakurssi Marknads-valutakurs Shows the exchange rate used to calculate the market value of the position in portfolio currency.

title: Available columns for positions listings
body: Orders Orders (all) Toimarit Toimarit (kaikki) Beställningar Beställningar (alla) Shows the effect the executable trade orders (orders) or executable and open trade orders (all) will have on the position's amount when executed. E.g. an executable sell trade order in the portfolio with the amount 100 will show as -100 in the columns.

title: Available columns for positions listings
body: PP / unit PP/u (c) PP/u (o) PP/u (oc) PP/u (desc.) Hh/kpl Hh/kpl (v) Hh/kpl (a) Hh/kpl (av) Hh/kpl (des.) PP/styck PP/styck (v) PP/styck (o) PP/styck (ov) PP/styck (desc.) Shows the purchase unit price of the security in the portfolio currency: the unit price the security was purchased with. Also available purchase unit price in currency (c), with the original price (o), with the original price in currency (oc) or with all available decimals (desc.). For accounts, the purchase unit price tells the exchange rate of currency of the account against the portfolio currency.

title: Available columns for positions listings
body: PPc/u PPc/u (c) Hhk/kpl Hhk/kpl (v) PPc/styck PPc/styck (v) Shows the purchase unit price without cost or purchase unit price without cost in currency (c).

title: Available columns for positions listings
body: Purchase value Hankintahinta Inköpsvärde Shows the total purchase value of the security or the account balance in the portfolio currency. Purchase value on the Overview excludes paid accrual on your fund positions (from FA 3.8 onward) and paid accrued interests on your bond positions.

title: Available columns for positions listings
body: Purchase value without cost Hankintahinta ilman kuluja Inköpsvärde utan kostnad Shows the total purchase value of the security or the account balance in the portfolio currency without costs.

title: Available columns for positions listings
body: Purch. val (o) Hankintahinta (a) Inköpsbelopp (o)Sh Shows the purchase value calculated with original price.

title: Available columns for positions listings
body: Security Arvopaperi Värdepapper This column divides the contents of the portfolio into securities and accounts. The securities are divided under subtitles based on the security types configured in the system, and the accounts section shows all the accounts added to the portfolio. The total of the securities and accounts are calculated, and you can find them on the rows Securities total and Accounts total . There are also a Portfolio total calculations available.

title: Available columns for positions listings
body: Share % Osuus % Andel % Shows percentage share of the position's market value from portfolio's total market value.

title: FA Format for importing contacts
body: # Code Required Name Description

title: FA Format for importing contacts
body: 1 c.contactId Yes Contact ID Unique ID for the contact (e.g. social security number or other unique identifier).

title: FA Format for importing contacts
body: 2 c.externalId No External contact ID E.g. social security number or other additional identification.

title: FA Format for importing contacts
body: 3 c.name Yes Name Contact name (e.g. first name and last name, company name, etc.).

title: FA Format for importing contacts
body: 4 c.type Yes Role(s) Define as a number: 1 = Customer 2 = Asset manager 3 = Broker 4 = Accountant 5 = Issuer 6 = Custody 7 = Lead

title: FA Format for importing contacts
body: 5 c.juridical Yes Juridical form Juridical form code (configured in the system)

title: FA Format for importing contacts
body: 6 c.status Yes Status Use the code of the status: A = Active P = Passive C = Closed

title: FA Format for importing contacts
body: 7 c.taxCountry Yes Tax country Country code (configured in the system)

title: FA Format for importing contacts
body: 8 c.memo No Memo Text, memo information

title: FA Format for importing contacts
body: 9 c.classification Yes Classification Classification code (configured in the system)

title: FA Format for importing contacts
body: 10 c.identity Yes Identity Identity code (configured in the system)

title: FA Format for importing contacts
body: 11 c.address1 No Address 1

title: FA Format for importing contacts
body: 12 c.address2 No Address 2

title: FA Format for importing contacts
body: 13 c.zipCode No Zip code

title: FA Format for importing contacts
body: 14 c.city No City

title: FA Format for importing contacts
body: 15 c.country No Country

title: FA Format for importing contacts
body: 16 c.phone1 No Phone 1

title: FA Format for importing contacts
body: 17 c.phone2 No Phone 2

title: FA Format for importing contacts
body: 18 c.fax No Fax

title: FA Format for importing contacts
body: 19 c.email No Email

title: FA Format for importing contacts
body: 20 c.electronicCommunication No Electronic communication Define as a number: 1 = allow electronic communication 0 = not allowed

title: FA Format for importing contacts
body: 21 c.marketingCommunication No Marketing communication Define as a number: 1 = allow marketing communication 0 = not allowed

title: FA Format for importing contacts
body: 22 c.nationality No Nationality Country code (configured in the system)

title: FA Format for importing contacts
body: 23 c.representatives No Representatives Comma-separated list of contact IDs representing the contact, for example, 1223,1224,1225. To import contact representative tag values, add them after ###: Standalone tags are added as <representative's contact ID>###<tag name>. For example: 04012000##parent.Single-select group tags are added as <representative's contact ID>###<group name>-<tag name>. For example: 04012000##relative-parent.Multi-select group tags are added as a comma-separated list of values: <representative's contact ID>###<group name>:<tag name 1>,<group name>:<tag name 2>. For example: 04012000###Employee:Finance,Employee:Accounting. You can use *** syntax to add new representatives and keep the existing ones. For example: ***,1223,1224. For details, see Updating contacts and portfolios. To add representatives to the contact that doesn't have any representatives, define "???," in the beginning of the column's content (e.g. ???,1223,1224). If the contact already had representatives, the existing representatives will be kept and the new ones won't be added.

title: FA Format for importing contacts
body: 24 c.language No Language Language code (configured in the system)

title: FA Format for importing contacts
body: 25 c.subType No Sub type Contact sub type code (configured in the system). When a sub type is given, it will find its own parent contact type and override the given contact type's code (in column 4).

title: FA Format for importing contacts
body: 26 c.transactionExtIdLevel No Transaction no. level Define as a number: 0 = No level constraint 1 = Portfolio level constraint 2 = Customer level constraint

title: FA Format for importing contacts
body: 27 c.contactExchanges No Settlement place Comma-separated list of contact settlement places with settlement place code (configured in the system) and counter information with BIC code. Use the following syntax to import settlement place information: <settlement place code>=<counter>. E.g. APKEFIHH=ESSEFIHX,MGTCBEBE=ESSEFIHX

title: FA Format for importing contacts
body: 28 c.tags No Tags Comma-separated list of tags. Tags import allows you to add new tags: Standalone tags are added with a <tag name>. For example: Fund,ContractOK.Single-select group tags should be added as <group name>-<tag name>. For example: office-Helsinki. If a contact already has a tag with the same group name, the tag is replaced.Multi-select group tags should be added as a comma-separated list of values <group name>:<tag name 1>,<group name>:<tag name 2>. For example: Interests:Golf,Interests:Culture. If a contact already has tags with the same group name, the new tag is added to the existing ones. You can use three minuses (---) syntax to remove a tag: Standalone tags: ---<tag name>. For example: ---Fund,---ContractOK.Single-select group tags: ---<group name>-<tag name>. For example: —office-Helsinki.Multi-select group tags: ---<group name>:<tag name 1>,---<group name>:<tag name 2>. For example: ---Interests:Golf,---Interests:Culture. For details, see Removing contact and portfolio values with three minuses (---).

title: FA Format for importing contacts
body: 29 c.classification2 No Classification 2 Classification 2 code (configured in the system).

title: FA Format for importing contacts
body: 30 c.classification3 No Classification 3 Classification 3 code (configured in the system).

title: FA Format for importing contacts
body: 31 c.profileAttributes No Profile Contact-specific profile (configured in the system). Use the following syntax to import / update profile information: <key>=<value>:<type>#<key>=<value>:<type> etc. Profile import allows you to add or modify profile values with a specific key - existing profile values are not replaced or removed unless you specifically include their key within the import syntax. You can use three minuses (---) syntax to remove a profile attribute value. For example: ---<key>. For details, see Removing contact and portfolio values with three minuses (---).

title: FA Format for importing contacts
body: 32 c.extContactIdList No External IDs List of contact's external ID's. Use the following syntax <ext_id1=ext_name1>,<ext_id2=ext_name2> etc. If ext_id and ext_name combination for the same contact exist just use the existing one, otherwise create new one. If ext_id and ext_name combination exist but for a different contact, will show error message.

title: FA Format for importing contacts
body: 33 c.keyFigures No Key figures Define the key figure code and individual observations as date-value pairs as a comma-separated list with the format <code>=<date:yyyy-MM-dd>=<value&>&<date:yyyy-MM-dd>=<value>:<code>=<date:yyyy-MM-dd>=<value>,... E.g. AAA=2009-01-01=1.9,2010-01-01=1.10:TAX=2007-01-01=1,2010-01-01=2 When importing categorized key figures (e.g. 1=Low, 2=Medium, 3=High), prior to 3.7.7 you should use the "number" (e.g. 1, 2 or 3), and after 3.7.7 you should use the "text" (e.g. Low, Medium, High). You can use *** syntax to add new observations and keep the existing ones. For example: ***:BBB=2007-01-01=1,2010-01-01=3. For details, see Updating contacts and portfolios.

title: FA Format for importing portfolios
body: # Code Required Name Description

title: FA Format for importing portfolios
body: 1 p.shortName Yes Portfolio ID Text or number uniquely identifying a portfolio. When creating a new portfolio, define AUTO to automatically use the next available number as the portfolio ID, if the "Generate a running number for portfolio ID automatically" is enabled in Portfolios Preferences.

title: FA Format for importing portfolios
body: 2 p.name Yes Name Portfolio name

title: FA Format for importing portfolios
body: 3 p.creationDate No Creation date yyyy-MM-dd. Date when the portfolio was created.

title: FA Format for importing portfolios
body: 4 p.extId No External ID External contract ID such as book-entry account number

title: FA Format for importing portfolios
body: 5 p.status Yes Status Use the code of the status: A = Active P = Passive C = Closed

title: FA Format for importing portfolios
body: 6 p.type Yes Type Type code (configured in the system)

title: FA Format for importing portfolios
body: 7 Match type Not used.

title: FA Format for importing portfolios
body: 8 p.currency Yes Reporting currency Reporting currency code.

title: FA Format for importing portfolios
body: 9 p.description No Description Open text field

title: FA Format for importing portfolios
body: 10 p.info1 No Info 1 Open text field

title: FA Format for importing portfolios
body: 11 p.info2 No Info 2 Open text field

title: FA Format for importing portfolios
body: 12 p.info3 No Info 3 Open text field

title: FA Format for importing portfolios
body: 13 p.notes No Notes Text, notes or memo on the portfolio.

title: FA Format for importing portfolios
body: 14 p.valuationMethod No Valuation method Use the code of the valuation methods: FIFO (default)FIFOP = FIFO (combined)AVER = Average priceAVER2 = Average price with adjustmentsAVER3 = Average price with separate items.

title: FA Format for importing portfolios
body: 15 p.language Yes Language Language code (configured in the system)

title: FA Format for importing portfolios
body: 16 p.primaryContact No Primary contact Primary contact (contact ID). To import representative tag values, add them after ###: Standalone tags are added as <contact ID>###<tag name>. For example: 04012000##parent.Single-select group tags are added as <contact ID>###<group name>-<tag name>. For example: 04012000##relative-parent.Multi-select group tags are added as a comma-separated list of values: <contact ID>###<group name>:<tag name 1>,<group name>:<tag name 2>. For example: 04012000###Employee:Finance,Employee:Accounting.

title: FA Format for importing portfolios
body: 17 p.contact No Other contacts Portfolio's other contacts. Contact IDs as a comma-separated list. To import representative tag values, add them after ###. Standalone tags are added as <contact ID>###<tag name>. For example: 04012000##parent.Single-select group tags are added as <contact ID>###<group name>-<tag name>. For example: 04012000##relative-parent.Multi-select group tags are added as a comma-separated list of values: <contact ID>###<group name>:<tag name 1>,<group name>:<tag name 2>. For example: 04012000###Employee:Finance,Employee:Accounting.

title: FA Format for importing portfolios
body: 18 Default account Not used.

title: FA Format for importing portfolios
body: 19 p.accounts No Accounts Colon-separated (:) list of portfolio's accounts. Use the following syntax to import account information: <Account no.>,<Currency with currency code>,<Name>,<Visibility as 0=not visible 1=visible>,<Shared as 0=not shared 1=shared>,<Priority as integer>;<BIC code>,<Mandate>,<Secondary account number>,<Category>,<Cash account as 0=not cash, 1=cash>,<Hide if zero as 0=don’t hide, 1=hide>,<Tags separated with #>,<Issuer with contact ID>,<Calendar with the calendar code>,<Fixing as a number>,<Base instrument with the security code>,<Spread as a number>,<Exclude balance as 0=don't exclude, 1=exclude>,<Shared with all as 0=not shared, 1=shared>, <Shared to all parent portfolio's subportfolios as 0=not shared, 1=shared>, <Decimals for transactions as a number>. For example, a list of two accounts: FI12 3456 78,EUR,Euro account,1,0,1,NDEAFIHHXXX,12345678,12345-678,Bank account,1,0,Client account#Status OK:234-321,USD,Dollar account,0,1,2,,,,,1,0,Client account#Status OK,,US30360,0.2,LIBOR,1.5,0,0,0,4 The account currency (second in the syntax) is validated to be a valid currency in the system. Supported calendar codes: 1/1 30/360ISDA 30/360 PSA 30E+/360 30E/360 30E/360 ISDA 30U/360 30U/360 EOM Act/360 Act/364 Act/365 Actual Act/365.25 Act/365F Act/365L Act/366 Act/366.375 Act/Act AFB Act/Act ICMA Act/Act ISDA Act/Act Year NL/365 You can use *** syntax to add new accounts to the contact and keep the existing ones. For example: ***:<Account>:<Account>). For details, see Updating contacts and portfolios. To update the account number of an existing account, use the syntax "[old account no]new account no" in the first field of the account syntax. For example, if you want to update account number from 1000 to 1010, define the account number in the syntax as [1000]1010. If you try to update the account number of an account that does not exists in the portfolio, importing creates a new account.

title: FA Format for importing portfolios
body: 20 p.assetManagers No Asset managers Portfolio's asset managers. Contact IDs as a comma-separated list. To import representative tag values, add them after ###. Standalone tags are added as <contact ID>###<tag name>. For example: 04012000##parent.Single-select group tags are added as <contact ID>###<group name>-<tag name>. For example: 04012000##relative-parent.Multi-select group tags are added as a comma-separated list of values: <contact ID>###<group name>:<tag name 1>,<group name>:<tag name 2>. For example: 04012000###Employee:Finance,Employee:Accounting.

title: FA Format for importing portfolios
body: 21 p.fees No Fees List of portfolio fees: <type>=<fee percent>. Types are: transaction, payment, withdrawal, management. E.g. transaction=2.3, management=1.5 You can use *** syntax to add fees to the portfolio and keep the existing ones. For example: ***,payment=3,withdrawal=3.9. For details, see Updating contacts and portfolios.

title: FA Format for importing portfolios
body: 22 p.startDate No Start date yyyy-MM-dd, portfolio start date

title: FA Format for importing portfolios
body: 23 p.updateDate No Update date yyyy-MM-dd, portfolio update

title: FA Format for importing portfolios
body: 24 p.ruleSet No Posting rule Code of the posting rule set. For multiple posting rule sets, use comma-separated list of posting rule set codes (available from FA 3.12 onward).

title: FA Format for importing portfolios
body: 25 p.extPortfolioIdList No External IDs List of portfolio's external ID's. Use the following syntax <ext_id1=ext_name1>,<ext_id2=ext_name2> etc. If ext_id and ext_name combination for the same portfolio exist just use the existing one, otherwise create new one. If ext_id and ext_name combination exist but for a different portfolio, will show error message.

title: FA Format for importing portfolios
body: 26 p.benchmark No Benchmark Benchmark code (configured in the system) or in order to use portfolio specific benchmarks, use the following syntax <yyyy-MM-dd>,<security1 code>=<share1>,<security code2>=<share2>:<yyyy-MM-dd>,<security code3>=<share3> etc. You can use *** syntax to add new entries to the existing benchmark and keep the existing ones. For details, see Updating contacts and portfolios.

title: FA Format for importing portfolios
body: 27 p.country No Country Country code (configured in the system), if not given will use primary contact's tax country

title: FA Format for importing portfolios
body: 28 p.juridical No Juridical Juridical form code (configured in the system), if not given will use primary contact's juridical form

title: FA Format for importing portfolios
body: 29 p.emailAddresses No Email addresses Comma-separated list of email addresses. E.g. a@fasolutions.com, b@fasolutions.com

title: FA Format for importing portfolios
body: 30 p.reportContacts No Report contacts Comma-separated list of contact IDs

title: FA Format for importing portfolios
body: 31 p.closeMethod No Close method Define as a number: 0 = "Choose" 1 = "No change" 2 = "Depreciation" 3 = "Depreciation and refund" 4 = "Market value"

title: FA Format for importing portfolios
body: 32 p.portfolioGroups No Group Comma-separated list of groups (codes) that the portfolio belongs to. Groups and their codes are configured in the system. You can use *** syntax to add new groups to the portfolio and keep the existing ones. For example: ***,<group code>. For details, see Updating contacts and portfolios.

title: FA Format for importing portfolios
body: 33 p.custody No Custody Contact for the custody (use the Contact ID to identify the custody).

title: FA Format for importing portfolios
body: 34 p.bookEntry No Book entry String value for book entry account

title: FA Format for importing portfolios
body: 35 p.modelPortfolio No Model portfolio Name of the model portfolio (configured in the system)

title: FA Format for importing portfolios
body: 36 p.costFormulas No Cost formula Comma-separated list of cost formula codes (configured in the system)

title: FA Format for importing portfolios
body: 37 p.tags No Tags Comma-separated list of tags. Tags import allows you to add new tags: Standalone tags are added with a <tag name>. For example: Fund,ContractOK.Single-select group tags should be added as <group name>-<tag name>. For example: office-Helsinki. If a portfolio already has a tag with the same group name, the tag is replaced.Multi-select group tags should be added as a comma-separated list of values <group name>:<tag name 1>,<group name>:<tag name 2>. For example: Investments:Stocks,Investments:Bonds. If a portfolio already has tags with the same group name, the new tag is added to the existing ones. You can use three minuses (---) syntax to remove a tag: Standalone tags: ---<tag name>. For example: ---Fund,---ContractOK.Single-select group tags: ---<group name>-<tag name>. For example: —office-Helsinki.Multi-select group tags: ---<group name>:<tag name 1>,---<group name>:<tag name 2>. For example: ---Investments:Stocks,---Investments:Bonds. For details, see Removing contact and portfolio values with three minuses (---).

title: FA Format for importing portfolios
body: 38 p.priceSource No Price source The method to determine the close market price for the securities in the portfolio. To use the prices from Security's Market data info tab, leave the field empty. To use the first available price from the price fields in the Security's Market data info tab (checking the column values in the order specified above), specify Default. To define a different priority of price source fields, enter a comma-separated list of columns in the order of priority. The values are: Manual, Close 1, Close 2, Close 3, Close 4, Close 5. You can use *** syntax to add new values in the list of price source fields and keep the existing ones. For details, see Updating contacts and portfolios. You can use three minuses (for example, ---Close 1) to remove a value.

title: FA Format for importing portfolios
body: 39 p.investmentPlan No Investment plan Portfolio-specific investment plan, use the following syntax <yyyy-MM-dd>,<security 1 code>=<share 1>,<security 2 code>=<share 2>:<yyyy-MM-dd>,<security 3 code>=<share 3> etc. If you want to import an investment plan with minimum and maximum shares, use the following syntax <yyyy-MM-dd>,<securityCode1>=<share1#minShare1#maxShare1>,<securityCode2>=<share2#minShare2#maxShare2>;<yyyy-MM-dd>;,<securityCode3>=<share3#minShare3#maxShare3> etc. Min and max shares are validated to align in relation to the target share (i.e. min smaller / max higher or equal to the target). (Available from FA 3.8 onward) You can use *** syntax to add new entries to the investment plan and keep the existing ones. For example: ***:2019-01-01,NOKIA=25#20#30,AMAZON=15#10#20. For details, see Updating contacts and portfolios.

title: FA Format for importing portfolios
body: 40 p.profileAttributes No Profile Portfolio-specific profile (configured in the system). Use the following syntax to import / update profile information: <key>=<value>:<type>#<key>=<value>:<type> etc. Profile import allows you to add or modify profile values with a specific key - existing profile values are not replaced / removed unless you specifically include their key within the import syntax. To remove an attribute value, use the syntax described in Updating contacts and portfolios. For example: :---<key>. You can use three minuses (---) syntax to remove an attribute value. For example: ---<key>. For details, see Removing contact and portfolio values with three minuses (---).

title: FA Format for importing portfolios
body: 41 p.strategy No Strategy Portfolio specific strategy, use the following syntax <yyyy-MM-dd>,<assetTypeCode1#assetGroupCode1>=<share1#minShare1#maxShare1#FIXED>,<assetTypeCode2#assetGroupCode2>=<share2#minShare2#maxShare2>:<yyyy-MM-dd>,<assetTypeCode3#asset & GroupCode3>=<share3#minShare3#maxShare3> etc. For interpolation, specify "INTERPOLATION", calendar code, and two dates before the asset types. For example: INTERPOLATION=SatSun:<yyyy-MM-dd>,<assetTypeCode1#assetGroupCode1>=<share1#minShare1#maxShare1>,<assetTypeCode2#assetGroupCode2>=<share2#minShare2#maxShare2>, etc. For an asset type that is excluded from strategy analysis, specify "EXCLUDED" followed by three dots: <yyyy-MM-dd>,<assetTypeCode1#assetGroupCode1>=EXCLUDED... You can use *** syntax to add new entries to the strategy and keep the existing ones, for example: ***:2019-01-01,ASSET#MOD=100#0#100. For details, see Updating contacts and portfolios.

title: FA Format for importing portfolios
body: 42 p.parent No Parent portfolio Comma-separated list of parent portfolios' Portfolio IDs. The imported portfolio will be marked as the sub-portfolio to all the defined parent / main portfolios. You can use *** syntax to add new parent portfolios and keep the existing ones. For details, see Updating contacts and portfolios.

title: FA Format for importing portfolios
body: 43 p.accruedInterestValuation No Accrued interest Define as a number: 0 = "Transaction date" 1 = "Settlement date" If no value is filled in, the default value 0 "Transaction date" is used. (Available from FA 3.1 onward)

title: FA Format for importing portfolios
body: 44 p.keyFigures No Key figures Define the key figure code and individual observations as date-value pairs as a comma-separated list with the format <code>=<date:yyyy-MM-dd>=<value>,<date:yyyy-MM-dd>=<value>:<code>=<date:yyyy-MM-dd>=<value>,... For example, AAA=2009-01-01=1.9,2010-01-01=1.10:TAX=2007-01-01=1,2010-01-01=2 You can use *** syntax to add new observations to the list and keep the existing ones. For details, see Updating contacts and portfolios. (Available from FA 3.4 onward)

title: FA Format for importing portfolios
body: 45 p.aggregatingSubportfolios No Aggregation of subportfolios Define as a number: 0 = Sum up values1 = Recalculate values

title: FA Format for importing portfolios
body: 46 p.locked No Locked Define as a number: 0 = Not locked (default)1 = Locked

title: FA Format for importing contacts

To import contact representative tag values, add them after ###: Standalone tags are added as <representative's contact ID>###<tag name>. For example: 04012000##parent.Single-select group tags are added as <representative's contact ID>###<group name>-<tag name>. For example: 04012000##relative-parent.Multi-select group tags are added as a comma-separated list of values: <representative's contact ID>###<group name>:<tag name 1>,<group name>:<tag name 2>. For example: 04012000###Employee:Finance,Employee:Accounting. You can use *** syntax to add new representatives and keep the existing ones. For example: ***,1223,1224. For details, see Updating contacts and portfolios. To add representatives to the contact that doesn't have any representatives, define "???," in the beginning of the column's content (e.g. ???,1223,1224). If the contact already had representatives, the existing representatives will be kept and the new ones won't be added.
